byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa reported from Sana, and Rod Nordland from Amman, Jordan. Ben Hubbard contributed reporting from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, and Kareem Fahim from Baghdad.
byline.original: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and ROD NORDLAND

abstract: Drone strike in Yemen reportedly kills four members of Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula, including prominent figure Harith al-Nadhari, who had publicly praised Paris terrorist attacks.
lead_paragraph: Harith al-Nadhari, who had praised the Paris terrorist attacks, was killed with three other members of Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula when their car was hit Jan. 31.

headline.main: Drone Strike in Yemen Said to Kill Senior Qaeda Figure
headline.print_headline: Drone Strike in Yemen Said to Kill Senior Qaeda Figure

snippet: Harith al-Nadhari, who had praised the Paris terrorist attacks, was killed with three other members of Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula when their car was hit Jan. 31.
